TopicTitle: The Chain Station - An exercise in double-docking

Articles.Content:
While I had originally played KSP "plain" -- no mods, at all -- and got quite far with it, I've noticed that recently I've been growing more and more dependent on MechJeb and other mods. In order to prove to myself that I could still do the "hard stuff" without any mods, I began a few different projects in a fresh install of KSP.

One of these projects is my new "Chain Station" -- five double-docked segments with sufficient housing for ten kerbals. (Only four are living there currently, though.)

I would have made it much longer, if I could, but I didn't want to abuse my poor, 6-year-old computer any more than I had to. (If I ever get a new computer, I'll definitely try something more ambitious.)
Okay, thats pretty damn cool making it look like a chain. I'm gonna have to steal that idea some time soon me thinks. Thanks for sharing!
Thats pretty neat. nice work doing that stock. I'd at least have needed the docking port alignment mod to pull off a double docking.
Docking with two ports at once DOES work then? I'd never tried it.

Docking with two ports at once DOES work then? I'd never tried it.

It works and was a common pratice for stronger docking connections before they added the SR docking port. The trick is you need to be very precise in your alignment. If your a degree or two off only the first one will connect. Placing 3 on a tri addaptor was the most common configuration I've seen in videos. I'v also seen a few other double docked ring shaped stations people have come up with.
